Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The biggest movie and TV franchise of all time, Star Trek spawned more than 700 TV episodes and twelve films. Creator Gene Roddenberry's vision of the future helped inspire today's scientists to develop the first scientific principles of teleportation, the creation of artificial intelligence, androids, and more.

Clip.Title: FREUD'S NAKED TRUTHS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind-the-scenes of artist Lucian Freud , grandson of Sigmund and see rare footage of him in his studio, where supermodels, gangsters, and British nobility sat for his portraits.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Smithsonian is the largest museum complex in the world, housing more than 136 million objects. With so many varied things to see, any object may seem out of place, but there's nothing random about it. Host Tom Cavanagh takes a closer look at the seemingly "random" collections.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: What does the Smithsonian have to do with food? Join host Tom Cavanagh as he learns to cook Native American dishes with the executive chef of Mitsitam Cafe; experience the American coffee break with the National Museum of American History, and visit the National Museum of Dentistry.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The biggest movie and TV franchise of all time, Star Trek spawned more than 700 TV episodes and twelve films. Clip.Title: FREUD'S NAKED TRUTHS

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The west coast of Newfoundland is a story of cultural history and beauty - from the first European settlements at l'Anse aux Meadows and Port au Choix, to the incredible, scenic beauty of Gros Morne National Park.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The west coast of Newfoundland is a story of cultural history and beauty - from the first European settlements at l'Anse aux Meadows and Port au Choix, to the incredible, scenic beauty of Gros Morne National Park.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The biggest movie and TV franchise of all time, Star Trek spawned more than 700 TV episodes and twelve films. Creator Gene Roddenberry's vision of the future helped inspire today's scientists to develop the first scientific principles of teleportation, the creation of artificial intelligence, androids, and more.

Clip.Title: FREUD'S NAKED TRUTHS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go behind-the-scenes of artist Lucian Freud , grandson of Sigmund and see rare footage of him in his studio, where supermodels, gangsters, and British nobility sat for his portraits.

Clip.Title: TANK ON THE MOON
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Revealing near-lost stories about Soviet-made robots that patrolled the Lunar surface in the 1970s.

Clip.Title: DOOMSDAY IN TUNGUSKA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the ongoing investigation over what caused one of the biggest explosions in history in June 1908, Siberia.

Clip.Title: BOTS OR BODIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Is man or machine better equipped to handle the rigors and risks of space exploration? Now that Mars is in our sights, would we be pushing our luck or pushing the boundaries?

Clip.Title: DENYING THE MOON LANDING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Apollo astronauts and scientific experts reflect on NASA's glorious achievement, and the shock of having their accomplishments questioned 40 years later.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Fishermen of Oman struggle to keep up with relief efforts after a massive Cyclone decimates their towns...A Cyclone that seemed to be strengthened by Global Warming.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With Spain being so close to Africa, Climate Change is fast-forwarding the desertification of the country.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet performs revolutionary surgical techniques to save the lives of his four legged patients. See Oscar the cat get a bionic foot transplant and Mayo the arthritic dog, an "X-Men" inspired surgical procedure.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: About the size of Texas, the island country of Papua New Guinea sits just to the North of Australia. At Papua's far eastern tip lies Milne Bay - holding one of the planet's highest concentrations of marine species.

Clip.Title: BLOOD RIVER CROSSING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A baby zebra and his mother join hundreds of thousands of wildebeest and other herbivores on a bloody mission through the predator-packed expanses of the Serengeti-Mara ecosystem. Their mission is survival, but when the mother and son become separated in the crocodile-infested Mara River, each must fight its own battle alone.

Clip.Title: DEATH BEACH
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A high number of fatal shark attacks along a South African beach leads a marine biologist on a mission to explain these predators' overly aggressive behavior.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet performs revolutionary surgical techniques to save the lives of his four legged patients. See Oscar the cat get a bionic foot transplant and Mayo the arthritic dog, an "X-Men" inspired surgical procedure.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: About the size of Texas, the island country of Papua New Guinea sits just to the North of Australia. At Papua's far eastern tip lies Milne Bay - holding one of the planet's highest concentrations of marine species.
